ManSection.Label: Sections
ManSection.Heading: Section(s)
ManSection.Description: Section(M,j,i) returns the section F_j / F_i, where F_j is the j-face of the base flag of M and F_i is the i-face of the base flag. Section(M,j,i,k) returns the section F_j / F_i, where F_j is the j-face of flag number k of M and F_i is the i-face of the same flag. Sections(M,j,i) returns all sections of type F_j / F_i, where F_j is a j-face and F_i is an incident i-face.

ManSection.Description: Returns the facet-types of M (i.e. the maniplexes corresponding to the facets). Returns the facet of M that contains the flag number k (that is, the maniplex corresponding to the facet). Returns the facet of M that contains flag number 1 (that is, the maniplex corresponding to the facet).

ManSection.Label: VertexFigure
ManSection.Heading: Vertex Figure(s)
ManSection.Description: Returns the types of vertex-figures of M (i.e. the maniplexes corresponding to the vertex-figures). Returns the vertex-figure of M that contains flag number k. Returns the vertex-figure of M that contains the base flag.

ManSection.Description: In the first form, returns true if every vertex of the maniplex M is incident to every facet. In the second form, returns true if every i-face of the maniplex M is incident to every j-face.

Section.Label: Chapter_Combinatorics_and_Structure_Section_Schlafli_symbol
Section.Heading: Schlafli symbol

ManSection.Description: Returns the Schlafli symbol of the maniplex M. Each entry is either an integer or a set of integers, where entry number i shows the polygons that we obtain as sections of (i+1)-faces over (i-2)-faces.

Sometimes when we make a maniplex, we know that the Schlafli symbol must be a quotient of some symbol. This most frequently happens because we start with a maniplex with a given Schlafli symbol and then take a quotient of it. In this case, we store the given Schlafli symbol and call it a pseudo-Schlafli symbol of M. Note that whenever we compute the actual Schlafli symbol of M, we update the pseudo-Schlafli symbol to match.

ManSection.Returns: the the maniplex M is equivelar; i.e., whether its Schlafli Symbol consists of integers at each position (no lists).

ManSection.Description: Returns whether the maniplex M has any sections that are digons. We may eventually want to include maniplexes with even smaller sections.

Returns whether the polytope P is tight, meaning that it has a Schlafli symbol {k_1, ..., k_{n-1}} and has 2 k_1 ... k_{n-1} flags, which is the minimum possible. This property doesn't make any sense for non-polytopal maniplexes, which aren't constrained by this lower bound.

ManSection.Returns: The Euler characteristic of the maniplex, given by f_0 - f_1 + f_2 - \cdots + (-1)^{n-1} f_{n-1}.
Whether the 3-maniplex M is spherical, which is to say, whether the Euler characteristic is equal to 2.
Whether the 4-maniplex M is locally spherical, which is to say, whether its facets and vertex-figures are both spherical.
Whether the 3-maniplex M is toroidal, which is to say, whether the Euler characteristic is equal to 0.
Whether the 4-maniplex M is locally toroidal, which is to say, whether it has at least one toroidal facet or vertex-figure, and all of its facets and vertex-figures are either spherical or toroidal.
The number of flags of the maniplex M.
ManSection.Description: Synonym: NumberOfFlags.

ManSection.Returns: The rank of the maniplex M.

Section.Label: Chapter_Combinatorics_and_Structure_Section_Zigzags_and_holes
Section.Heading: Zigzags and holes

ManSection.Returns: The lengths of j-zigzags of the 3-maniplex M.
ManSection.Description: This corresponds to the lengths of orbits under r0 (r1 r2)^j.

ManSection.Returns: The lengths of all zigzags of the 3-maniplex M.
ManSection.Description: A rank 3 maniplex of type {p, q} has Floor(q/2) distinct zigzag lengths because the j-zigzags are the same as the (q-j)-zigzags.

ManSection.Returns: The length of the petrie polygons of the maniplex M.

ManSection.Description: Returns the Petrie relation for a rank i maniplex of length j.

ManSection.Returns: The lengths of j-holes of the 3-maniplex M.
ManSection.Description: This corresponds to the lengths of orbits under r0 (r1 r2)^(j-1) r2.

ManSection.Returns: The lengths of all zigzags of the 3-maniplex M.
ManSection.Description: A rank 3 maniplex of type {p, q} has Floor(q/2) distinct zigzag lengths because the j-zigzags are the same as the (q-j)-zigzags.
